00011         TCP_ClientSocket::TCP_ClientSocket(string address,int port)
00012         {
00013                 cout << "client socket\n\n";
00014 
00015                 strcpy(strHostName , address.c_str());
00016                 nHostPort = port;
00017 
00018                 printf("\nMaking a socket\n");
00019                  //make a socket
00020                 hSocket=socket(AF_INET,SOCK_STREAM,IPPROTO_TCP);
00021 
00022                 if(hSocket == SOCKET_ERROR)
00023                     {
00024                         printf("\nCould not make a socket\n");
00025                         return;
00026                     }
00027 
00028                 //        get IP address from name
00029                  pHostInfo=gethostbyname(strHostName);
00030 
00031                  // copy address into long
00032                  memcpy(&nHostAddress,pHostInfo->h_addr,pHostInfo->h_length);
00033 
00034                  // fill address struct
00035                  Address.sin_addr.s_addr=nHostAddress;
00036                  Address.sin_port=htons(nHostPort);
00037                  Address.sin_family=AF_INET;
00038 
00039                  printf("\nConnecting to %s on port %d",strHostName,nHostPort);
00040 
00041                 //  connect to host
00042                  if(connect(hSocket,(struct sockaddr*)&Address,sizeof(Address))
00043                    == SOCKET_ERROR)
00044                  {
00045                         printf("\nCould not connect to host\n");
00046                         return;
00047                  }
00048 
00049 
00050         }
00051

00053         TCP_ClientSocket::~TCP_ClientSocket()
00054         {
00055 
00056             printf("\nClosing socket\n");
00057             // close socket
00058             if(close(hSocket) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00059             {
00060                 printf("\nCould not close socket\n");
00061                 return ;
00062             }
00063         }

00065         string TCP_ClientSocket::readData()
00066         {
00067                 /* read from socket into buffer
00068                 ** number returned by read() and write() is the number of bytes
00069                 ** read or written, with -1 being that an error occurred */
00070                 nReadAmount=read(hSocket,pBuffer,BUFFER_SIZE);
00071                 printf("\nReceived \"%s\" from server\n",pBuffer);
00072 
00073                 return pBuffer;
00074         }
00075 
00076         int TCP_ClientSocket::putData(string data)
00077         {
00078                 /* write what we received back to the server */
00079                 write(hSocket,data.c_str(),nReadAmount);
00080                 printf("\nWriting \"%s\" to server",data.c_str());
00081 
00082         }
